goal: Analyse the current implementation of sindarin, create different permutations of sindarin programs in the /tmp/ directory, compile and run them to be sure everything it is capable of right now works, do not add any language features merely test to be sure everything works as expected, if you find issues, introduce a failing test to isolate the problem, then make the test pass. If your sinarin does not compile, be sure the syntax is correct before making code changes.

plan.goal: Analyse the current implementation of sindarin, create different permutations of sindarin programs in the /tmp/ directory, compile and run them to be sure everything it is capable of right now works, do not add any language features merely test to be sure everything works as expected, if you find issues, introduce a failing test to isolate the problem, then make the test pass. If your sinarin does not compile, be sure the syntax is correct before making code changes.
plan.analysis: I need to systematically test the Sindarin compiler by understanding its capabilities from the codebase, creating comprehensive test programs covering all language features, compiling and running them, and fixing any issues found with proper test isolation.

steps.description: Explore the codebase to understand all supported language features (types, operators, control flow, functions, lambdas, closures, string interpolation, etc.)
steps.failReason: No active session. Call startSession first.

steps.description: Review existing sample programs and integration tests to understand working syntax patterns
steps.failReason: No active session. Call startSession first.

steps.description: Create test programs for basic types and literals (int, double, str, char, bool) in /tmp/
Create test programs for operators (arithmetic, comparison, logical, unary) and expressions
Create test programs for control flow (if/else, while, for loops)
Create test programs for functions (declarations, calls, return values, recursion)
Create test programs for lambdas and closures (based on recent commits)
Create test programs for string interpolation and complex expressions
Compile and run all test programs, documenting any failures
For each failure, create a minimal integration test to isolate the issue, then fix the code to make the test pass

plan.raw:
ANALYSIS: I need to systematically test the Sindarin compiler by understanding its capabilities from the codebase, creating comprehensive test programs covering all language features, compiling and running them, and fixing any issues found with proper test isolation.

PLAN:
1. Explore the codebase to understand all supported language features (types, operators, control flow, functions, lambdas, closures, string interpolation, etc.) | medium
2. Review existing sample programs and integration tests to understand working syntax patterns | simple
3. Create test programs for basic types and literals (int, double, str, char, bool) in /tmp/ | simple
4. Create test programs for operators (arithmetic, comparison, logical, unary) and expressions | simple
5. Create test programs for control flow (if/else, while, for loops) | simple
6. Create test programs for functions (declarations, calls, return values, recursion) | simple
7. Create test programs for lambdas and closures (based on recent commits) | medium
8. Create test programs for string interpolation and complex expressions | simple
9. Compile and run all test programs, documenting any failures | medium
10. For each failure, create a minimal integration test to isolate the issue, then fix the code to make the test pass | complex

TOTAL_STEPS: 10
